title.rendered: Vaughan Home Remodel: 4 Things To Consider

content.rendered:
Houses are not timeless. Every home, even with a timeless design, will need maintenance and repair. While you might think you’re ready for home repairs near me or to dive right into a remodel, it is best to wait and collect your thoughts.

Too many homeowners jump into remodelling projects, forgetting to assess their risks and needs before signing contracts. While you might want a brand new kitchen, do you need new cabinets? If you do, what style?

Figuring what you want and when you need it are only two elements of a remodelling decision. Take your time, and do your homework. No one is rushing you.

4 Considerations Before a Remodel

Remodelling a house offer occurs in several phases: budgeting, planning, demolition, installation, and finishing. Before you rip cabinets off the walls and bust through drywall, take the time to make the relevant considerations.

1. Budget

Understanding your budget is key to any remodel. Your budget will influence every decision and phase of the process.

Even if you have a small budget, you can accomplish drastic changes. For example, with a budget of $2,000, you can significantly upgrade a space. While you likely can’t afford to rehab your entire kitchen, you can upgrade fixtures and possibly refinish cabinets.

Obviously, the larger your budget, the more you can do. For a kitchen remodel, you will probably want a budget between $10,000 and $50,000.

2. Style

Besides the budget, you want to consider your style. Do you go for a more traditional, contemporary, or rustic look? Perhaps you like a more eclectic design. Whatever your design style, you want to work with a contractor who understands it.

Also, your current house design may not represent the style you want. Sometimes, people have to remodel in phases, which means the style of the home will evolve as more projects are completed.

Do not let a contractor talk you out of something you want. You are in charge of your aesthetic. However, if you are unsure of your style, consider consulting an interior designer; they can help you select finishes, decorations, and integrated tech.

3. Contractor

Do not choose your contractor on a whim. Put in the necessary research to ensure you work with an experienced professional capable of the work you hire them for. For example, if you are looking for a Vaughan plumbing professional, search for licensed individuals with several years of experience. You might want to look for someone with a brick-and-mortar business rather than an independent worker.

When searching for a contractor, look for reviews and ask for referrals. Also, never commit to the first contractor you talk to; always get multiple estimates for the proposed work.

4. Timing

In construction, timing is not always on your side. Most projects will run into delays. The most common causes of delays include:

  • Weather
  • Deliveries
  • Material availability

You need to maintain realistic expectations in terms of timing. Your contractor will do their best to complete your job on the schedule you expect, but issues arise, which is why many professionals give tentative deadlines or projections.

Working With Experienced Professionals

There is nothing wrong with hiring a new contractor; some do quality work. The problem with hiring young contractors is they don’t have the work history or referrals of workers in the business for five to 10 years. Experience establishes trust, which is what you want.

Are you ready to start a home remodel, or are you just in the planning stages? Contact the professionals working with Handyman Connection. The service only works with experienced contractors, so you are sure to work with only the best, meaning your home remodel will receive only quality finishes.
